charges.potential_sentence: Class A misdemeanor: Up to 1 year county jail, up to $2,500 fine

charges.description: Domestic Battery (physical contact of insulting or provoking nature)
charges.potential_sentence: Class A misdemeanor: Up to 1 year county jail

arrest.location: Client's residence, 567 N. Michigan Avenue, Chicago, IL
arrest.circumstances: Responding to 911 domestic disturbance call from neighbor

search_and_seizure.location_searched: Client's apartment (walked through to check for injured parties)

statements_made: We were just arguing, I never touched her
She's lying, she pushed me first
Check my phone, I have recordings of her threatening me

discovery_received.summary: CPD domestic battery report with officer narrative
Recording of neighbor's 911 call reporting 'loud argument and screaming'
Alleged victim statement claiming client pushed her and grabbed her arm

discovery_outstanding: Body camera footage from both officers
Medical records from alleged victim (if she sought treatment)
Any prior domestic calls to this address
Any text messages or communications between client and alleged victim
Client's phone recordings referenced in statement

constitutional_issues.description: Client was subjected to custodial interrogation without Miranda warnings. All statements should be suppressed.
evidence: Police report shows client was in handcuffs during questioning
Client was not free to leave
No Miranda warnings documented or given
Officers asked accusatory questions ('Did you hit her? Did you push her?')

constitutional_issues.description: Entry into apartment may have been without valid exigent circumstances or consent. Need to challenge search.
evidence: 911 call was from neighbor, not from inside apartment
Client denies giving consent to enter
Officers entered without warrant and without seeing/hearing any disturbance

matter.defense_theory: This is a false accusation by client's girlfriend following a verbal argument. No physical contact occurred. Alleged victim has history of making false accusations (need to investigate). Neighbor's 911 call only reported hearing 'loud argument' but no sounds of physical violence. Client's statements should be suppressed as they were obtained in violation of Miranda during custodial interrogation. Body cam footage will show no visible injuries on alleged victim and will corroborate that argument was only verbal. Client has recordings on his phone of alleged victim threatening him and admitting she would 'call the cops' to get him in trouble.

goals.primary: Dismissal - no evidence of physical contact
goals.fallback: Supervision/deferred prosecution to preserve clean record

matter.client_narrative: My girlfriend Jennifer and I have been together for three years. We live together. On May 3rd we got into an argument about money and bills. It was heated and we were yelling at each other, but I never touched her. I would never hurt her. At some point a neighbor must have called the police because they showed up and knocked on the door. I opened it and they asked what was going on. I tried to explain we were just arguing but they pushed past me into the apartment. They separated us and talked to Jennifer first. Then they put me in handcuffs and started asking me if I hit her or pushed her. I kept saying no, I didn't touch her. They didn't read me my rights. After about 15-20 minutes they arrested me. Jennifer has threatened before to 'call the cops' on me when we fight. I actually have recordings on my phone of her saying she would do this. I never hurt her and there's no evidence I did because it didn't happen. This whole thing is a lie.
